title: Sebastian Bach: I'm Worried Pantera Lyrics Might Have Nazi Connotations After Anselmo's Salute Incident [News]
text:
Posted 4 hours ago 0 
While singing praises of Pantera for their musical and lyrical qualities, Sebastian Bach expressed concern that the band's lyrics - which he considered very intelligent - might actually have Nazi connotations following Phil Anselmo's salute incident. 
Remembering how he toured with Pantera and Anthrax back in 1997 with his solo band, the singer said on Talk Is Jericho : 
"This was back when Phil Anselmo performed shirtless every night, that's how long ago that shit was! [Laughs] He was ripped, he was like a god - he looked like Rollins! 
"All working out, in shape, but mean and stylish and cool. He cared about his appearance then. I'm not saying he doesn't now, but he doesn't now. [Laughs] He did then - he was the frontman, he looked amazing and intimidating onstage. 
"With those amazing songs and their live power, they were deadly. There was no band like that - they sounded like Slayer meets ZZ Top with the Van Halen vibe of fun. They had groove, that was their secret." 
Reaching the lyrics, Sebastian added: "And they had very intelligent lyrics, I thought, at the time. Now that there's that controversy that happened with Phil, I don't know if those lyrics were saying something I didn't even fuckin' know, which freaks me out and I hate thinking about it, but that's really none of my business."This is not the first time Bach addressed the Dimebash incident, as he tweeted back in late January: "Rock is supposed to be fun. Perverting music into hate? NOT fun. People who say White Power are PUSSIES. As are those who agree. Or remain silent."Reaching a bit more jolly themes, Bach remembered how Dime pranked him during that same tour, saying: 
"One time I go onstage and my lips start fuckin' BURNING! I go, 'What the fuck?!' And I start to wipe in and I wipe it in my eyes and my EYES ARE BURNING ONSTAGE!! Like, really bad! I go, 'What the fuck?!' And I turn and I look, and Dimebag is over there with a bottle of tabasco. They had doused my mic in fuckin' tabasco and it sucked, it really sucked. They were laughing their heads off."
